Omg... He absolutely destroyed this! Some of the greatest lyrics that I have ever 
heard on top of some nice beats. It's so dark and you can tell he's angry 
and fed up like you can literally feel the emotion. I think every year 
Drake gets better! I guess this is what he meant when he said he already 
has spring 2015 poppin.

real hiphop anyone who thinks that this trash is real hiphop needs their ears 
examined, all these syrupy lame hooks, wack lyrics, terrible. the only 
reason i gave it one star is because it makes you do it to submit the 
review. if u wanna hear real hiphop check out Logic, he is WAAAAY better 
than Drake.

I don't know... His bars were dope, but I was just not feeling the production. I would 
usually find one or two songs that I would immediately like on his albums, 
but it's hard for me to achieve that in this. Maybe his next album that's 
set out for the summer?

Not sure why this is so popular Drake really dropped the ball on this album, it sounds and looks like a 
mixtape with mostly throwaway tracks, but of course the production was 
great. Sadly, the lyrics are more bland than usual and never really reach 
some of his earlier work. It seems like Drake is not really interested in 
dropping a great verse, and is trying to take the Migos route. I wish this 
was better, but out of all major artist to drop an album this year this 
album is the most disappointing. I'll stick with Take Care for now.

Worst drake yet! Sick of 0-100 drake that has no depth or lyricism, i want Take Care drake 
that was actual fire!"through the 6 with my woes"trash lyrics

This album is sick. Loves how he changes the beats on some of the songs

2 stars because I could only find 2 decent tracks on this album. Bring the

Olly Murs ripped his song off, too Ya'll are the laziest reviewers, do some research. You hear the horn 
section in her songs? She has a 50s/60s doo-wop sound. That "Dear Future 
Husband" sample was from Dion's "Runaround Sue". And yeah, her songs are 
"woman-power"- another homage to 50s/60s. Some songs aren't great, but 
overall, it's a solid album. I haven't heard an album in decades that 
doesn't have 1 or 2 songs that fall flat.

Some Fun? I am disappointed with this album. After listening to songs such as the 
fun ones like All About That Bass, Lips Are Moving, and Dear Future Husband 
and slow songs like Close Your Eyes and Title, I expected something great 
out of this album. I was very wrong though. The whole album is a huge 
confusing mix. I didn't love it nor I hated it, it just felt weird, bad 
weird. Meghan Trainor won't be known forever.

Refreshing The over all sound, that combines oldies with new generation pop, is 
lovely. I truly enjoy the upbeat, positive message that she puts out there. 
Excellent way to boost women's confidence nowadays. Keep the good vibes 
coming.

Meghan Trainor is really an awesome artist, a star in the making. She found 
a way to integrate that classic doo-wop vibe with a decent touch of pop, 
and she can sing basically anything! The face gives me a hint of a younger 
Adele, but the voice is incomparable. Props to you!

she is such a talent! so glad to see her showing of her vocals on this album, close your eyes is 
just beautiful. so is love you like i'm gonna lose you! so happy that she 
is showing off those vocals & proving she is a real talent not just good 
for catchy pop songs, LOVE HER!

I guess if you're under 25 or so, you'll like it. If you're an adult... not 
so much. The lyrics are very immature. Some of the songs are catchy, but 
otherwise it was a huge waste of my money. #Disappointed

Trashy sexist songs. Her songs are so bad, and filled with sexist garbage. Terrible artist, 
terrible message sent to children and terrible songs.

She's a Fifth rate Adele She glorifies obesity, don't tell me she is 'curvy'. You can clearly see 
the fat in her face, it's sad and I pity her. I don't care if someone is 
fat or not, but to put out a song about weight and for you to be fat and 
glorify it is asinine. All I care about is the quality of the tracks. She 
is a mediocre singer at best. You can't really see her full potential 
because this album only showcases doo-wop/pop songs. If you want to hear 
her full vocal abilities listen to her Grammy performance with John legend. 
It was atrocious at best. To hear her struggle to hit notes is torturing. 
She should stick to her old day job, writing hits for performers. And you 
think she wrote those hits? In the industry 10 people will write songs 
together so they can split the royalties. She probably writes one stanza at 
most. Her career as a pop artist will go like the wind. Well that's pretty 
common for session songwriters with mediocre creative writing skills--no 
story whatsoever. Hey! She can be a backup vocalist. At least we don't have 
to hear her voice completely.

AAAAAAAH-MAZING! I LOVED your album, Meghan!!!! All your songs are really catchy & fun to 
listen to, and it's great to hear something so fresh and exciting!!!! Most 
of all, I love how you portray your feelings about girls who should not be 
judged by their appearance, rather by their personality (or not at all), in 
this biased society. It's great to finally have a singer in this world who 
know how to sing, make her own songs, AND smartly display her and others 
feelings about societal issues, such as the one's aforementioned

Meghan Trainor is awesome I don't care what people say Meghan Trainor is the best singer ever I love

I love Meghan Trainor I real love Meghan Trainor, don't get me wrong. She has a great voice, I 
think she's very talented and has potential to go really far in her career. 
However, I'm going to have to be honest. This album had it's issues. There 
were some pretty good catchy songs, but ballads don't really mix with her 
voice. She gave it her best shot, I'll give her that, but the ballads just 
didn't fit. Overall, the album wasn't that great. Some of the songs just 
don't grab your attention, and it's very inconsistent genre wise.

Awesome, but... ...it is a little annoying to have her album out a little bit early, 
because only 2 of those tracks have been published so far, and, there's 15 
songs. 2 out of 15? Not great. I would of bought it, but it would be stuck 
in my phone, absorbing my memory. Great album by good-example setting Megan 
Trainor. But bring it out in a few months instead! Also, to all you silly 
people saying "Oh its all the same!" Etc. You're ignorant as when an artist 
records an album, they base it around the same rythm and genre. :/
